intro: Eschweilera neei, commonly known as the Neem tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring a straight trunk and dense foliage. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and elliptical in shape, with a smooth surface. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed.
